name: py-pennylane

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: PennyLane is a Python quantum machine learning library by Xanadu Inc.

dependencies.name: py-appdirs
dependencies.description:
A small Python module for determining appropriate platform-specific
dirs, e.g. a "user data dir".

dependencies.name: py-autograd
dependencies.description:
Autograd can automatically differentiate native Python and Numpy code.
It can handle a large subset of Python's features, including loops, ifs,
recursion and closures, and it can even take derivatives of derivatives
of derivatives. It supports reverse-mode differentiation (a.k.a.
backpropagation), which means it can efficiently take gradients of
scalar-valued functions with respect to array-valued arguments, as well
as forward-mode differentiation, and the two can be composed
arbitrarily. The main intended application of Autograd is gradient-based
optimization. For more information, check out the tutorial and the
examples directory.

dependencies.name: py-autoray
dependencies.description:
Write backend agnostic numeric code compatible with any numpy-ish array
library.

dependencies.name: py-cachetools
dependencies.description:
This module provides various memoizing collections and decorators,
including variants of the Python 3 Standard Library @lru_cache function
decorator.

dependencies.name: py-flaky
dependencies.description:
Flaky is a plugin for nose or pytest that automatically reruns flaky
tests.

dependencies.name: py-networkx
dependencies.description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pennylane-lightning
dependencies.description:
The PennyLane-Lightning plugin provides a fast state-vector simulator
written in C++.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pytest
dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.

dependencies.name: py-pytest-benchmark
dependencies.description: A pytest fixture for benchmarking code.

dependencies.name: py-pytest-mock
dependencies.description: Thin-wrapper around the mock package for easier use with py.test

dependencies.name: py-pytest-xdist
dependencies.description: py.test xdist plugin for distributed testing and loop-on-failing mode

dependencies.name: py-requests
dependencies.description: Python HTTP for Humans.

dependencies.name: py-retworkx
dependencies.description: A high performance Python graph library implemented in Rust.

dependencies.name: py-rustworkx
dependencies.description:
Rustworkx was originally called retworkx and was was created initially
to be a replacement for qiskit's previous (and current) networkx usage
(hence the original name). The project was originally started to build a
faster directed graph to use as the underlying data structure for the
DAG at the center of qiskit-terra's transpiler. However, since it's
initial introduction the project has grown substantially and now covers
all applications that need to work with graphs which includes Qiskit.

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-semantic-version
dependencies.description:
This small python library provides a few tools to handle SemVer in
Python. It follows strictly the 2.0.0 version of the SemVer scheme.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-toml
dependencies.description:
A Python library for parsing and creating TOML configuration files. For
more information on the TOML standard, see https://github.com/toml-
lang/toml.git

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).

dependencies.name: py-wheel
dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependent_to.name: py-pennylane-lightning-kokkos
dependent_to.description:
The PennyLane-Lightning-Kokkos plugin provides a fast state-vector
simulator with Kokkos kernels.
